title: Computer mouse lag, audio lag, CPU capped after every champion select
body:
Title says it all.

I have a 4790k, R9 390x, and plenty of power in general to run this game. So that's out of the question

I've played the game both on my SSD and SSHD. The only difference is that on the SSD the lag only lasts about 4 seconds, whereas on my SSHD the lag lasts over 10 seconds.

Every single time champ select finishes and the LeagueofLegends.exe program boots up, my CPU completely caps out. Discord lags out, Youtube videos in the background lag out, all audio in general (including my own outgoing) is narrowed down into almost Dial-up speed from today's standards quite literally. Not to mention, I can't even control my cursor properly because my actual desktop has less than 1FPS.

I have tried reinstalling the game multiple times and scowering forum posts to help fix this issue, but there seems to be nothing to help me. This has been an ongoing issue for months and I've been putting it off for a while, since it wasn't really a big deal. But after a while it's gotten to me, and I'd like to hear from your guys' experiences.

I genuinely have no clue what's going on. The only other game that did something like this was DOOM 2016 on release, and Bethesda corrected that issue a few weeks after launch. Nothing is wrong with my PC's hardware, it's definitely some conflicting settings, or just something horribly wrong with the actual game.

My specs are as listed below:

Computer
CPU: Intel 4790K
Motherboard: MSI Z97 Gaming 5
RAM: 32GB Corsair Vengeance Pro 1600MHz
GPU: MSI R9 390X 8GB Stock Speed
Case: Corsair 760T Red/Black
Storage: Seagate 2TB SSHD, HyperX Fury 240GB
PSU: Corsair AX860i
Monitors: 3 x Dell U2414H
Monitor Stand: Ergotech 100-D16-B03
Cooling: Corsair H110i GTX
Operating System: Windows 10

The most notable thing is that I'm running a triple monitor setup.

replies.body:
Yikes it really sounds like your pc is having a really hard time running League for some weird reason. It seems like it's an issue with hardware/software slowing down since you mentioned...

> Every single time champ select finishes and the LeagueofLegends.exe program boots up, my CPU completely caps out. Discord lags out, Youtube videos in the background lag out

I know this will kind of feel like a shotgun solution, but go ahead and check over the steps in this [**FPS guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting). Those steps cover a lot of the basics and can help most random issues, and if those don't help hit up our techs in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). They can look over your game logs and specs to get a bigger picture of what's happening during that lag.

So I did everything on that guide that I could.

The very _first_ bootup of a game lagged out extremely bad.

Then after i closed out, and booted up another game, and even different game modes. They all loaded up with zero spikes or any previous problems I mentioned before. Which puts me at square one. Since the problem happened once, and now I can't re-create it :\

It's probably too small of an issue to actually bring up to the team. It might just have something to do with my setup and how windows is storing/retrieving recent files. I can't re-create it on my spare PC either, so it's just this system specifically from the looks of it.

Thanks for your time and the reply.

Hmmmmm it could be related to those drives possibly and how they're transmitting data? I would still go ahead and reach out to those techs, they might be able to tell what's happening exactly from your game logs!
bump before i go to bed.
